chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para:
The user interface is devided into a tool bar and the actual board. At the main window lower end a status bar shows information about the status of the game. (see
)

listitem.para: Choose new nonogram: Choose a new nonogram to play. The currently running game will be stopped!
Restart current game: Currently running or last finished game will be restarted.
Pause running game: Pause or resume the currently running game.
Stop running game: Stop currently running game and count it as lost.
Options: Calls options dialog to set preferences. E.g. the game mode can be set or keys can be assigned.
Help: Shows a help dialog with information about playing FreeNono.

Nonogram editor (per default not active): With the nonogram editor you can create your own nonograms. Per default the editor is not active but will be available in the following versions. The created nonograms can be shared with other players.
Info: Shows information about authors and program version.
Quit FreeNono: Quit FreeNono when user do not want to play anymore.

Status field: Shows informations about the currently running game. If set as preference the name of the current nonogram is shown as well as the game mode and associated data like remaining game time or errors left. These information depend on the chosen game mode of the running game.

Game board: In the game board the player can fill the nonogram according to the given hints in the margins. Large nonograms can be scrolled via keyboard or mouse. A preview helps to get an overview of the board when playing these large nonograms.

The margin numbers that help solve the nonogram as well as the current active field are visually marked. With mouse or keyboard fields can be marked as belonging to the picture. To assist the player fields can also be marked with an X to show that it is not part of the picture. When all fields of the nonogram are correctly marked the game is won.
